contentrichtext.text: [[File:Emily, 1st Vicountess Hambleden, and her daughter, by Richard Buckner.jpg|thumb|Emily, 1st Vicountess Hambleden, and her daughter ([[Richard Buckner (artist)|Richard Buckner]])]] '''Viscount Hambleden''', of [[Hambleden]] in the County of Buckingham, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1891 (as Viscountess Hambleden) for Emily Danvers Smith, in honour of her deceased husband, the businessman and [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician [[William Henry Smith (1825–1891)|William Henry Smith]]. Both their son, the second Viscount, and grandson, the third Viscount, were involved in the management of the family business, [[W H Smith]]. {{As of|2012}} the title is held by the latter's grandson, the fifth Viscount, who succeeded in 2012. Much of the family estates were sold in 2007,<ref>Eden, Richard. [http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/celebritynews/9469403/Abba-singers-lover-becomes-a-viscount.html "Abba singer’s lover becomes a viscount"]. ''The Telegraph'', 12 August 2012</ref> but the first wife of the late 4th Viscount, Maria Carmela Attolico di Adelfia, still lives in the Manor House, as of 2012.<ref>[http://www.henleystandard.co.uk/news/news.php?id=1150638 "Viscount Hambleden dies in US, aged 82"], ''Henley Standard'', 13 August 2012</ref> ==Viscounts Hambleden (1891)== *[[Emily Danvers Smith, 1st Viscountess Hambleden]] (1828–1913) *[[William Danvers Smith, 2nd Viscount Hambleden|William Frederick Danvers Smith, 2nd Viscount Hambleden]] (1868–1928) *[[William Smith, 3rd Viscount Hambleden|William Henry Smith, 3rd Viscount Hambleden]] (1903–1948) *[[William Smith, 4th Viscount Hambleden|William Herbert "Harry" Smith, 4th Viscount Hambleden]] (1930–2012)<ref>{{cite web | url = http://announcements.telegraph.co.uk/deaths/152609/hambleden| title = Telegraph Announcements - Hambleden| accessdate = 7 August 2012}} </ref> * [[Henry Smith, 5th Viscount Hambleden|William Henry Smith, 5th Viscount Hambleden]] (b. 1955) ==See also== *[[William Henry Smith (1792–1865)|William Henry Smith]] ==References== {{Reflist}} *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990. *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} ==External links== *{{Hansard-contribs | mr-william-smith-3 | William Herbert Smith, 4th Viscount Hambleden }} {{British viscounts}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hambleden}} [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
